resume: With over 14 years of experience in the field of image processing and data science, I am passionate about designing and driving software products that meet user needs and leverage cutting-edge data science technologies, artificial intelligence and cloud computing. I worked in image processing and software development for Galderma R&D (Nestlé Skin Health), Nonolive, Airbus, European projects, Inria, Institut Curie and Universities. Each of my experiences gave rise to patents or scientific publications.

items.content: Clients needs analysis
Organized product development between product manager, scrum master and data scientists (15 people)
Led roadmaps build, milestones definition and work packages definition
Design of a new architecture to enable software modularity and scalability
Led assessment workflow to produce product specs
Development of deep learning algorithms and analysis pipelines

experiences.title: Data Project Manager at Inria & Institut Curie

items.content: Led the development of BioImageIT, a software that enable biologists to access cutting-edge data analysis tools
Consulting in data science for external companies: Airbus, EIT-Digital…
Development of deep learning models and user interfaces for bio-imaging applications
5 scientific publications including IEEE and Nature Method
Management of a microscopy image analysis facility: trainings, data storage maintenance, custom analysis solutions development.
Led the development of Platform-Manager a web app that allowed to divide by 5 the needed time to monitor facilities.
5 scientific publications including Development and Current Biology.
Development of tracking algorithms for 3D+t microscopy imaging.
Evaluation of market needs for bio-image analysis tools in pharmaceutical market
1 scientific publication

experiences.title: Data Scientist at Inria & Galderman R&D

items.content: Development of machine learning algorithms for early clinic diagnosis of skin disorders using multispectral imaging.
Development of an end user interface to analyse clinical studies.
The developed algorithms allowed to devide by 3 the time of a pre-clinical trial
5 patents, 4 scientific publications, 1 software

education.title: PhD in computer science at Inria

Signal processing, image processing, telecom
